website_summaries.verdict: The Ryka Influence 2.5 was highly recommended by dance workout enthusiasts and those who enjoy high-intensity training. One of the welcomed features was the Pivot Point as it allowed for smooth twists and turns without putting pressure on the knees and ankles. The cage-like lacing system also appealed to many training enthusiasts who were looking for a shoe with adequate lateral support. Though the trainer received positive reviews, some wearers were not pleased that it did not have adequate ankle and heel support. It also caused foot discomfort and pain for several individuals.
pros: The majority of owners stated that the Ryka Influence 2.5 was comfortable to be worn for extended periods
Numerous reviewers adored the design and style of the trainer
Many users claimed that it was great for dance-related exercises and high-intensity workouts
The Pivot Point feature was much appreciated by plenty of commenters as it allowed for quick foot-transitions during the routines
Several people mentioned that they liked how the lacing system hugged their feet
A few consumers stated that the shoe offered adequate heel and arch support
Some fitness enthusiasts were pleased that it did not need breaking in
cons: Many gym-goers stated that it did not offer enough support in the ankles and the heel
There were claims that the Influence 2.5 caused foot or knee pain after a few hours of use

customer_reviews.title: Not right for weight lifting or cross training
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes hoping they would be the right thing for cross training and weight training but they were a disappointment. During weight lifting they felt flimsy and like my feet weren't connected with the ground. During dynamic movements such as burpees and box jumps they felt flimsy and sloppy. I also tried some short runs in workouts with them and got calf cramps. Unfortunately I'll be returning them. They also cause pain for my bunion. I had high hopes for Ryka and I hope these shoes aren't indicative of the entire line.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lisfranc injury in my left foot. I do HIIT style boot camp classes, so I was having an issue finding shoes that we comfortable. My foot is always going to hurt at times, but these shoes really decrease the impact. I have narrow foot and heel, and these shoes are very secure. They are by far the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. I have a couple different styles from Ryka, but these are by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: hapygirl718

customer_reviews.title: Not as wide as you'd expect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I read the reviews and these were recommended for Zumba. They did not work for me! I bought wides but they felt more narrow than regular non wide shoes. I ended up with an extremely sore foot after wearing these one night to class. I even ended up with xrays because the pain was so bad. I wouldn't suggest these for someone with wide feet!
customer_reviews.author: Smurfie80

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Slender shoe perfect for my narrow feet. I am a Zumba instructor and this may be my 8th or so pair of the same... will use nothing else since has pivot point, good support for arch and tendons on side, breathable material in areas where feet sweat during cardio.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for making those shoes. NO More Bunion issues.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. My mom s been doing Zumba and keeping healthy at 68 since starting the classes 2 months ago. no pain in the knees, hip, back...no more. But she has pain in the bunion. Ordered a pair with extra width...after 2 weeks she said best shoes ever and no bunion pain. Thanks for making those shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny_desigN

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I take a weekly zumba class and my first pair of Ryka were wearing out. They had been the best shoes for all the jumping around. Well this new pair is nothing like the first. They feel slightly tight, the arches hurt, the tongue of the shoe is a weird piece of vinyl instead of the usual padded style and the shoe strings are too short for the shoes. I was able to get through zumba but was so ready to take these off.
customer_reviews.author: TracyH

customer_reviews.title: It’s made for women’s feet and they are perfect for HIIT training.
customer_reviews.text: There’s nothing I don’t love about this shoe for the type of training I do. They take the impact of HIIT training like a champ and my feet never hurt. They have great foot forward support and are steady enough for lateral moves too...I buy them 1/2 size bigger to account for for foot swell (personal choice) and have zero issues with the shoe being too big. If you’re still not sure in size, buy 2 and try them on. Return the ones you don’t want. Easy Peasy! I’ve recommended these shoes to all of the women at my gym and those that made the purchase also love them!
customer_reviews.author: gloria senatore

customer_reviews.title: 3 months in...
customer_reviews.text: At first, the cushion and toe/arch support was amazing! I Jazzercise at least 6 days a week and already the insole is almost flat - most of the insole is broke down...usually a pair of comfort sole cross-trainers last me 6 months. My only other complaint is that the stitching where the tongue meets the lace holes is bulky and sometimes folds over and rubs. I also did not realize that the tongue wasn't cushioned - it's flat vinyl - kind of rubs the front of my foot if I don't pull my socks up high enough. I really thought these would be a perfect shoe, but I won't order the Influence 2.5 again.
customer_reviews.author: Laurann Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Odd fit
customer_reviews.text: Overall quality of shoe is good. But theres definitely an odd sole to these shoes. It feels like your feet slide down to the end and get smooshed into the mesh toe box. Hopefully they'll break in overtime.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, but not impressed with the quality of construction
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these shoes for the short amount of time they were intact. After a couple of days to get used to the strange construction of the tongue, they've been extremely lightweight and comfortable, providing excellent support for my weak arches. Unfortunately, after less than a month of use, one of the elastic tie downs used to help support the arches came apart, and I have no way of attempting to repair it because it's sandwiched between several layers.
customer_reviews.author: Laugh38

customer_reviews.title: lightweight & comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I put these shoes on the day after I received them, thinking to break them in for a bit before delving into some Zumba classes. They were so comfortable and lightweight on my feet, I hardly knew I had them on and wore them for a full day! I purchased 7W after reading reviews about the shoes being a bit narrow, even though I'm able to wear 7M in most shoes. So glad I did. The 7W fit perfectly! I'm totally satisfied with my Rykas.
customer_reviews.author: JudithK

customer_reviews.title: Loving them more and more
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! Light weight. Super springy. Would be perfect for any kind of fitness activity. Bought them for zumba. They are a little sticky for the sliding, but I guess they are brand new. Didn't love them when I first put them on. But gave them a chance and I am loving them more and more. The foot bed feels a little funny at first but now (3 weeks) it fits great!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Hurt the top of my foot
customer_reviews.text: I hate writing bad reviews but I bought these shoes specifically for ZUMBA after googling best shoes for ZUMBA. I so wanted to love them but the second i put the left shoe on it started hurting the top of my foot, the right one was fine so I'm very perplexed by this, never had shoes do this before so sadly I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for dance aerobics, don’t slip on floor
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes for my dance aerobics class which I teach and/or attend several times a week. I have wide feet due to bunions and these shoes fit perfectly. The exercise floor is slippery but these shoes are very sturdy and I don’t slide. I’ve bought other Ryka shoes that are just as comfortable but they tend to slide a bit. I also like that these shoes have a “lower” fit and don’t rub against my ankles or the front of my feet. I’ve bought three pairs of this style in the last 1.5 years and will buy more in the future if they still sell them. I do wish they came in more colors!
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Not like Rykas to me
customer_reviews.text: I usually have ok luck with buying Ryka's short of the mesh around the bend of the toes splitting right after I get them. The sizes are usually right, however, this one was so short. I ordered a size 9 and they seem like less than an 8. Absolutely not extra room at the tip. The tongue is also hard and not smooth over the top of the foot. Weird. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Fit well
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes and the first few workouts were great, but I think they’ve stretched a bit because now when do lateral moves my foot slides around in the shoe. They look great and are lightweight and comfy though.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Badger

customer_reviews.title: Narrow shoe
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to keep this shoe but I had to return it. Its narrow. good news is its gorgeous in person and very supportive when walking. If you have narrow feet, definitely buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Inserts are needed
customer_reviews.text: I really liked Ryka, started wearing them over twenty years ago. I have found the quality of their product has gone the way of all shoes made in foreign countries. These shoes, cross trainers, are not as comfortable as I had hoped. I really like the look and will find inserts to get the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Shirlon Chesbro

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Ryka’s and they’re a little disappointing, they don’t seem to be as well made and it true what everyone says that the thin tongue seems to make them very underwhelming. I will keep them but next pair will have to be a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for turning.
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful after reading all the reviews that I was going to actually be able to dance in these shoes. My hopes were quickly dashed. These are still rubber-soles shoes, so even with that little round spot on the sole at the ball of the foot, turning is not easy. I line dance and east coast swing. Va k to the drawing board...
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: I like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes. The Tongue is a not cushioned but I knew that from reading reviews ahead of time. The shoes fit great and are light weight. The only problem I have is that only wearing them for week one on the rubber pieces on the bottom is coming loose. I super glued it back in because I like the shoes. Hope the rest stays in place...lol Actually after wearing them a month they are hurting the top of my feet . So I don't recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I am a Ryka addict. They are great for everything and keep my feet from hurting. I got this pair for walking. As usual always but a size up or at least half a size. They run large but once you get your size figured out they fit wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Schraeder

customer_reviews.title: Tongue of shoe is thin, stiff and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have been pleased with other Ryka styles for Zumba, such as Exertion and Graphic Flow. Influence 2.5 is an attractive shoe, but the tongue is thin and stiff, and the edge dug into the front of my leg. The toe box was also too wide, making the shoe slip around. I am satisfied with another Ryka style I just purchased, the Devotion XT.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Ryka always a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: I love Ryka. Fit is perfect and amazon is the only place I can find my size. Perfect for jazzercise.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gordom

customer_reviews.title: Not my style
customer_reviews.text: I decided after further research that a cross trainer is not what I need. The shoe fits okay but the function is not. It’s not the shoe, it’s me😊
customer_reviews.author: Dorothea

customer_reviews.title: Fits Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought the wide version and I like the fit. I wear them to walk the neighborhood and walk on the treadmill at home.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, I did add my shoe inserts, but these shoes are very comfortable, light weight, and really nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Great training shoe for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great training shoe. There is snug but not right support for lateral moves, nice flat foot bed for lifting. These are lightweight so they won't slow you down either!
customer_reviews.author: jillmarieg

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good fit for variety of workouts!
customer_reviews.text: Great show for cardio/strength training, and even Zumba. Fits well on wide feet!
customer_reviews.author: Faye A

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and fits small
customer_reviews.text: Felt very flimsy. Very disappointed in the quality. And they were very tight. Replaced for next size up and it was still uncomfortable/ tight fit. But shoe felt like it would fall apart very easily... not good quality. Didn’t feel durable or fit well. Returned both pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good Zumba Workout Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn my Influence 2.5 Cross Trainer shoes four days to my Zumba morning class this week. I ordered a size 9-and-a-half with a wide width. The shoes are doing what they are supposed to do: help my arthritic knees and offer great arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased. Need more time.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is great, but I need more time at aerobics to comment now. I need to make a change. This cross-trainer shoe is stylish, but does provide the proper support needed for cardio aerobics.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie Deak

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three pairs, because the price was fantastic and these shoes are a perfect cross trainer. They're flexible at the toe, have great traction, and nice cushiining.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small and narrow
customer_reviews.text: Exceedingly small for a size 8.5 and medium width. Fit is narrow, stiff and uncomfortable. My toddler ripped the tag off and the tissue that came in the box too and now I have to give them away as they are unwearable.
customer_reviews.author: Stkmstr650

customer_reviews.title: Not really a good arch support
customer_reviews.text: The shoes don't fit as expected and they are not that comfortable. I was surprised by the lack of room in the front of the shoe. Definitely try before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Fits small
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned about 20 pairs of rykas and these are definitely not my favorite. They narrow at the top and feel smaller than my size. Lateral supposed isn’t bad but forward waking is uncomfortable. Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jido K

customer_reviews.title: Tongue of shoe is very uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why Ryka would make the tongue of the shoe so thin with no padding. It actually cuts into my ankle and is very uncomfortable. I will definitely be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: J. MUKAI

customer_reviews.title: I change the inserts but they are a good sneaker for Zumba
customer_reviews.text: I change the insert but they are a good sneakers for
customer_reviews.author: Janine Chiarelli

customer_reviews.title: Not a great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Wide shoes were too tight. Didn’t like the plastic tongue either. Not comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.author: janniebird

customer_reviews.title: They are a comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased ryka tennis before which is why I keep purchasing them
customer_reviews.author: Cherrone Matthews

customer_reviews.title: shoe runs small but has other issues
customer_reviews.text: shoe tongue is too long and stiff and cuts into my leg
customer_reviews.author: Jan T. Mckay

customer_reviews.title: Should have sent back as not enough support for ankles for me
customer_reviews.text: Too low to provide ankle support but good on surfaces
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M Medina

customer_reviews.title: They feel good!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes feel good and fit! I've used Ryka for years. Worked as a medical tech and stood on my feet for almost eight hours a day and was on a mission to find the most comfortable shoe to work in. Found them and have worn them ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Labrat 1

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for my cardio and strength work outs.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: great for Jazzercise
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit for a wide foot and the cushioning. I would like the tongue to also be cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise shoe!
customer_reviews.text: They are the best shoe for me when doing Jazzercise, the toe is a little snug but I love how supportive these are and yet still flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bivens

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I hoped for more of a cushioned sole, especially under the toe, but this shoe is an all-around good cross training shoe for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Rae Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: While the fit and comfort of this shoe is great, the durability is not. I am a fitness instructor, after 3 weeks of classes the tread of the shoe is tearing. Extremely disappointed by this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: If you need a very wide width keep looking!
customer_reviews.text: The length was fine, but the W was too narrow for my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Lady

customer_reviews.title: Shoes run small
customer_reviews.text: I should not have been surprised after reading the other reviews that I, too, would return these shoes, but the shoes were small and they looked and felt cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne J Puente

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits well for my wide feet, and the heel portion does not slip off.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit the same as other RYKA's. Created pain in my arch. :(
customer_reviews.author: MVP

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as I had hoped - will need an insole.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: The tongue is thin which I like. Very breathable
customer_reviews.text: Thought there would be more padding. The tongue is thin which I like. Very breathable. Should of looked at the pictures better. Don't like the 2 white dots at the bottom or the black and white mix in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Tanis

customer_reviews.title: Not like my old Rykas
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has a plastic tongue which is very uncomfortable. I do not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Dingus

customer_reviews.title: Don't care for the new style of tongue on this shoe
customer_reviews.text: The original "Influence" is great, and I've had two pairs, but I did not like this Influence 2.5 at all. Rather than a typical padded tongue, this one is very thin, so the top of the shoe really cut into my foot. I ended up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

product_meta.title: RYKA Womens E5060M2 Influence 2.5
product_meta.description: A mid-height upper on our devotion XT construction, the devotion XT mid features heel and midfoot lock down webbing systems. Internal achilles comfort cushion and ankle strap provide comfort and stability.
feature_bullets: Breathable mesh with No-Sew overlays and supportive independent lacing system
